item.title: Introduction to the Tidyverse
item.description: The tidyverse is a set of actively developed and well-maintained R packages to facilitate the typical data analysis workflow. We’re going to demo it using data from the COVID Tracking Project in the US.

img { border-radius: 50%; width: 20em; } I’m Morgan, a second year systems biology / bioinformatics PhD student in the Forslund Lab at the Experimental and Clinical Research Center in Berlin, Germany. My academic background consists of a BSc in Pharmaceutical Sciences from Purdue University (2015) and a MSc in Systems Biology from Heidelberg University (2018). Though my curiosity to learn the inner workings of the human body has been the strongest influence of my career decisions, I have nurtured a joy for programming since I first took Java in high school.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Here’s where I’ll eventually link to all the tagged/categorized resources I’ve used. Work by Megan Diddie.
